activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander Nikolayevich Shevelev

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  *Rescheduled from 8:45 a.m. at Attorney Howard's request*
Bail/bond hearing on August 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.
A victim in this matter has requested to be notified during all proceedings

Activity: Preliminary hearing and arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:56 PM Defendant Alexander Nikolayevich Shevelev in court by video with attorney Robert C Howard by video.  Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kim Rau appeared by video for Victim Witness with victim M.S. by video. Sworn testimony by Officer Michael Feirn. Sworn testimony by Officer Douglas Thiering. Witness identifies the defendant. State moves for bind over. Defense objects. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for filing of information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts. Matter to be set.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

09:48 AM Defendant Alexander Nikolayevich Shevelev in court by video means and with attorney Robert C Howard by video means.  Emmeline Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. Motion for bond modification. Court modifies bond to allow defendant to have 1 time trip to residence with law enforcement to retreive personal belongings.  Preliminary hearing requested, by zoom, time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

No contact directly or indirectly with victims M.V.S or P.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Defendant may have 1 time visit to residence, with law enforcement, to retreive personal belongings. No possession of weapons or firearms. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone.
Bail/bond hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victims M.V.S or P.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No possession of weapons or firearms. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 1PM.
